Get a data.frame (in long format) of population by age for multiple countries

Source: R/age_countries.R
age_df_countries.Rd

Get a data.frame (in long format) of population by age for multiple countries

age_df_countries(countries)

Arguments

countries

A character string or a vector of character containing the names of the countries for which to return contact data

Value

A data.frame (in long format) with 3 columns:

  • country: the country name

  • age: the age group

  • pop: the number of people in this age group

References

https://www.census.gov/programs-surveys/international-programs/about/idb.html

Examples

age_df_countries(c("Austria", "Belgium"))

#>     country   age population
#> 97  Austria 70_74     412613
#> 98  Austria 65_69     463005
#> 99  Austria 60_64     577840
#> 100 Austria   5_9     413258
#> 101 Austria 55_59     699785
#> 102 Austria 50_54     716265
#> 103 Austria 45_49     617300
#> 104 Austria 40_44     556170
#> 105 Austria 35_39     600221

#> 108 Austria 20_24     490270
#> 109 Austria 15_19     427882

#> 111 Austria   0_4     420129
#> 112 Austria   75+     876154
